snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown’s $8-billion-a-year school ballot initiative to raise California taxes has run into a competing proposal, as well as some minor financial scandals.
abstract: Voters in California must decide between two education initiatives that aim to raise funds for schools while raising taxes; Proposition 30, sponsored by Gov Jerry Brown, would increase statewide sales taxes and impose an income tax surcharge on residents who earn more than $250,000 annually; Proposition 38, which is backed by civil rights lawyer Molly Munger, would raise income taxes on nearly all wage earners, although wealthy Californians would bear most of the burden.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown’s $8-billion-a-year school ballot initiative to raise California taxes has run into a competing proposal, as well as some minor financial scandals.

headline.seo: Californians Face Competing Tax Increase Propositions
headline.main: Californians Face Rival Ballot Initiatives That Would Raise Taxes and Aid Schools
headline.print_headline: Californians Face Rival Ballot Initiatives That Would Raise Taxes and Aid Schools
